barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin's deposition in the case of Groce v. Keep, July 18, 1825.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1149

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin's deposition in the case of Groce v. Keep, July 18, 1825.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Deposition (Copy)*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Jared E. Groce*/person_mentioned* having called on me to state what passed between him and *person_mentioned*Doctor Imla Keep*/person_mentioned* at the time the Goods were landed which were brought on from *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*by said *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*I have to State that a difficulty arose between *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*and the*person_mentioned* owner of the vessel*/person_mentioned* in which they were brought as to the freight, and *person_mentioned*Groce */person_mentioned*repeatedly stated that he had plac'd Money in *person_mentioned*Keep*/person_mentioned*s hands to purchase sundry articles for him in *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*, and that he should hold *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned* responsible for the manner in which that money was expended—that he had nothing to do with the Goods until he recd, them of *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*and would then credit him for this amount on the Sums due by *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*to him, *person_mentioned*Groce*/person_mentioned*, on account of Monies placed in *person_mentioned*Keep*/person_mentioned*'s hands.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-18-1825">July 18,1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
